Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Distal Radial Artery Access in Pediatric Catheterization

Participants.evidence: 412 children aged 3–12 years, scheduled for arterial blood gas analysis via the DRA due to serious respiratory diseases, at Changzhou Second People's Hospital

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the feasibility of DRA access by measuring the DRA diameter in the anatomic snuffbox (AS).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the corrected DRA diameter in the AS.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 412 children aged 3–12 years, scheduled for arterial blood gas analysis via the DRA due to serious respiratory diseases, at Changzhou Second People's Hospital between June 2023 and October 2023.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The corrected DRA diameter was 1.97 ± 0.37 mm, with no significant difference between males (1.98 ± 0.38 mm) and females (1.95 ± 0.35 mm) (p = 0.457).
